name: Link Hotel

reviews.text: We stayed two nights at Link Hotel, mid week in April. The hotel is spotlessly clean and the rooms are well furnished and comfortable. A nice range of complimentary toiletries were supplied in the bathroom.
reviews.title: Boutique or Bijou?

reviews.text: Although the hotel emphasised the themed rooms, we were not given any options.
reviews.title: Love the comforter

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was ideal for a couple of nights but would have been a bit claustrophobic for any longer. If you require an extra bed or would need a travel cot in the room be sure to check out the size of the room as we found it difficult to fit in a travel cot
reviews.title: Plesant surprise

reviews.text: We had breakfast in the hotel restaurant, which although more expensive than the local eateries. was very nicely presented.
reviews.title: Chic, but need more improvement

reviews.text: The local area is interesting and about a seven minute easy walk from the MRT which is very efficient and can comfortably get you around Singapore in a short time.
reviews.title: Lovely experience

reviews.text: Having lived in the East all my life, it was great to discover this hotel in Tiong Bahru. I never knew Tiong Bahru is so interesting!
reviews.title: Interesting location!

likes.liked: — Location has many things to discover.

reviews.text: The hotel is smacked in the middle of some very good food (loved the steamboat behind the hotel) and cute architecture. Reminds me of my granny's place (torn down now :( ).
reviews.title: horrible experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked a superior room. Room is small but neat and clean. I like the size actually. More cosy. The day view and night view is very different. In the day, the room is full of light. At night, the warm, cosy lighting is good to fall asleep in. Maybe because I haven't been to hotel in long time but I like the fluffy blanket. Not like what we have last time, the hospital-like blankets.
reviews.title: Overpriced and small rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just opposite the hotel is a Hong Kong Cafe. Great if you want a bite at night but don't want room service. We wanted to go clubbing but didn't know what bus to take. Asked the conceirge who told us they have shuttle service to Chinatown. Near enough and free also.
reviews.title: Overpriced Hotel

likes.liked: — Green apples provided by the Hotel

reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel for family vacation in June 2008. The hotel was clean & spotless. The service was okay, except when I tried to call housekeeping several times, there was no response. The room was a little bit smaller than other Singapore hotels I stayed before. No movie channels. The hotel is located near Tiong Bahru MRT station (10' walk) and Outram Park station (7' walked), and within 5' walk you can find Tiong Bahru Market that has plenty of good food stalls. The conclusion : we were quite satisfied with the hotel, and may stay again for our next visit.
reviews.title: Clean & cozy, good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked through Singapore Air Stopover. Stayed one night while in transit. The hotel is a bit out of the way if you are here for a short time on an extended layover. The room itself was very small and smelled as if someone had been smoking in it. It was okay for what it was. The nicest thing was the LCD TV. The staff were friendly. If I were to do it again I would of booked at the Crown Plaza which is connected to Terminal 3 and saved myself a couple hours of sleep before the flight.
reviews.title: Okay a bit out of the way

reviews.text: stayed 2 nights in a superior room. comes in 4 themes, Chinese, Indian, Malay, and Modern. dont ask me which one my room was themed after, i dont know any different.
reviews.title: ok hotel. value for money given the location.

likes.liked: — value for money given the location; free internet access; cable tv

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: value for money: price is just about right, given size of room, quality of room and location of hotel.
reviews.title: Nice boutique hotel

reviews.text: hotel room: size is just a little small, but that's ok given that its not a room to be enjoyed but to sleep in. they have cable tv (korean, japanese, sports, news, etc) and LCD tv so that's pretty cool.
reviews.title: A cozy stay with Link Hotel

description: Discover Singapore with Link Hotel. Indulge in the comfort of home in this biggest boutique hotel within the conservation site, with universal amenities. You get to experience the dynamic blend of nostalgia and a touch of modernity in the rich heritage of one of Singapore's oldest heartland, Tiong Bahru.The hotel features an array of accommodation, meeting and dining needs, along with compact hotel facilities and services to offer leisure and business travellers the local living experience and a taste of Singapore.Strategically situated along the heritage conservation site and walking trail of one of Singapore’s oldest heartland, Tiong Bahru estate, Link Hotel is the first hotel to be converted from two conservation pre-war public housing development flats initiated by Singapore Improvement Trust (SIT).The hotel is ideally located near Central Business District and many famous tourist attractions such as the Singapore River, the Merlion, Clarke Quay, Sentosa, Marina Bay, Garden by the Bay, Esplanade Theatres on the Bay. It is also accessible to shopping areas like Bugis Street and Orchard Road within minutes of travel.Within 10-15 minutes walking distance from the hotel to the nearest subway station, Outram MRT, travellers get to seek adventures of a lifetime and venture into the cultural districts of Chinatown.At Link Hotel, guests come first with our welcoming service. Indulge in the comfort of being at home while home away with universal amenities within reach. Get intimate in different ethnic-themed rooms to experience the melting pot of cultures in Singapore.Join in the serenade of bird songs in our annual bird concert at the historic bird corner next to the hotel. Be enthralled by the evening stunning picturesque of Singapore’s skyline at the hotel roof top’s breeze beer garden where you can unwind after a bustling day of activities.New experiences await guests’ discovery as they experience the local living and a taste of Singapore. Take a walk down the memory lane of some of the conservation buildings around the hotel and discover the hidden gems of old Singapore in the blend of modernity. The plethora of food choices will surprise you as you embark on culinary explorations of local and international cuisines within the hotel premises and the neighbourhood.
